programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: A look at how Hitler implemented changes through anti-Semitic clothing laws, the establishing of SS bride schools and breeding programmes that saw children stolen from their parents.

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: In this episode we'll examine how the Nazis began to stamp their image on Germany and the nations that had fallen under the German jackboot. From plans to redesign Berlin as the capital of the world, to the destruction of Warsaw.

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: In this episode we'll uncover support for the National Socialist movement within America, revealing outposts of Nazi Germany within the land of the free. We'll also learn about the man thought he believed he was the American Fuhrer.

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: In this episode, Guy looks at the Nazi plans for Britain. From pre-war spying, concentration camps on British soil, to national landmarks earmarked by Hitler for his own use.

programme.title: Nazi Jihad
programme.desc: As Allied forces close in on Germany, the Nazi dream looks to be over. However, two men will carry Hitler's vision beyond Germany: Otto Skorzeny and Amin Al Husseini. From their Nazi stronghold in the Middle East, these men create a new kind of terror.

programme.title: High Hitler and His Nazi Supersoldiers
programme.desc: Newly discovered secret files reveal the huge drugs program that fuelled the Nazi war machine. Led by Hitler, himself possessed by narcotics, the German troops consume tens of millions of Crystal Meth tablets throughout the war, driving them to extremes.

programme.title: Mad Science: Nazi Killer Bugs
programme.desc: Hitler famously said he was against biological weapons, but new evidence shows the Nazis were colluding with experts on germ warfare. They had a deadly plan to launch a disease attack on the Allies that could have even changed the course of the war.

programme.title: Hitler's Executioner
programme.desc: The story of Johann Reichhart, the man who went from German state executioner before WW2 to head up a merciless Nazi killing machine which murdered thousands. In a bizarre twist of fate, Reichhart ended up working for the Allies.

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: In this episode, we'll see how Hitler used the Olympic games to promote Nazism. How he controlled the leisure time and holidays of his Citizens by developing the world's largest travel agency. And how by constructing the world's biggest beach resort.

programme.title: Hitler's Empire: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: At look at how Hitler's redesign of the German transport system was a key factor in his preparations for war, including how he used the car industry for the rearmament of his military and see his plans for a colossal rail system.

programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: By late summer 1944, the Allied forces in north-west Europe were thrusting towards the German border. Paris and Antwerp were liberated, but then supply problems brought the advance to a halt. Meanwhile, Stalin had halted his main thrust towards Berlin.

programme.title: World War II: Witness to War
programme.desc: Listen to the astonishing stories behind the liberation of France and hear the price many soldiers had to pay in order for the Allies to take France back from the Germans.

programme.title: Too Cute!
programme.desc: A Miniature Schnauzer pup tries to befriend a high-spirited ferret. A Maltipoo pushes the boundaries set by her young parents. And, a German Shorthaired Pointer pup wants to prove the she's the ultimate hunting dog, but is shown up by a cat.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Francesco is living in fear of his girlfriend's cat, Pootie. Sandy and Phil were happily married until they adopted their cat Woody. Sandy and Phil are convinced Woody terrorized their deceased cat Velvet so much that he killed her with stress.

programme.title: The Crocodile Hunter
programme.desc: Steve and his best mate Wes set out on an adventure through the wild islands of Indonesia looking for the best surf. Both accomplished surfers, the pair encounter some of the more venomous snakes of Indonesia as well as lizards and mischievous monkeys.

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Sloths Tina and Rico live together at the zoo, spending up to 18 hours a day asleep. For the past three years, Tina has spent her waking moments giving Rico a hard time. Now there's a plan to try and bring them closer together.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Zoo staff make the journey to east Africa to return to the wild thousands of toads they helped rescue from extinction. Utu, the test-pilot giraffe, tries out a new piece of equipment. And the bird department works to save the lives of millions of birds.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters

programme.title: Tanked!

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Sui, ready for more responsibility, tests herself by taking the lead in a rescue. An adopter looks for a dog that will feel at home around her many chickens and Tia rescues a pit bull with scars that reveal a painful past.

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.desc: In Mongolia, Jeremy hopes to reel in a rare river monster that's become legendary.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: In southern Africa there are rumours of a deadly fish that lurks unseen in the eerie waters of the Okavango.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy journeys to Nepal where rumours of a deadly man-eating catfish have surfaced, and tries to determine if the Goonch has returned, or if a new monster is on the loose.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: An overweight cat with kidney disease needs a miracle if it is going to survive. Dr. Jeff battles to save a dog hit by a car while the owners are on an overseas mission.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: With the holidays approaching, the clinic is busier than ever. Dr. Jeff performs emergency surgery on a dog found tied to a fence. The staff host a fun run to raise money for animals in need. And a stray Pomeranian finds its forever home.

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Kendari the babirusa, pig-deer type animal from Indonesia, is pregnant. But the two short-clawed otters she shares a paddock with are behaving like antisocial neighbors, throwing stones at her house while she's settling down to give birth.

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Spring is in the air at Chester Zoo and many of the animals are giving birth. Penguin parents Indigo and Amber are bringing up their new chicks, Munch and McCoy. But an outbreak of disease in the colony leaves Munch fighting for his life.

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Sumatran tiger mom Kirana is facing the loss of her sons, Topan and Jaya. They're now adults, and being moved to other zoos to start families of their own. But keepers are unsure how Kirana and her remaining cub will react to the departure of the boys.

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The Sumatran orangutans have been getting used to new quarters, when keepers see that Subis, Tuti, Siska and Indah have gone missing. The keepers must rely on their understanding of the escapees to try to tempt them back inside.

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Christmas is approaching. The keepers are hoping to include the animals in the festivities, but not everyone is getting into the Christmas spirit.

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Rhino couple Beni and Asha have been kept separate for the last four years while mum Asha has been raising the couple's daughter, Komala. But now Komala is leaving home, and the couple are due to be reunited.

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Young giraffe mum Tula gives birth, while both the penguin chicks and a silvery gibbon baby must face their fears as they grow up.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A rowdy, young markhor is injured and vets must treat his infected hoof. The TAB staff head to Manhattan to rescue a wallaby living in an apartment, while a fruit bat discovers how to spread her wings, and a trio of alligators move into their summer home.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: After more than 100 venomous snakes are taken from a private home, it's up to the zoo to care for them. Two Pronghorn fawns make their debut, but problems arise that have keepers concerned, while a device is built for a Red River hog needing a challenge.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A trio of rare Dhole canines are prepared to make their cross-country journey to the zoo, and keepers anxiously await their arrival. A tinamou chick must be hand-reared, while a specialized tool is welded to extract a tusk from a charming Babirusa.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The staff is hopeful for a successful breeding season when Mshango the giraffe meets the females of the herd. Power tools are needed for an Amur tiger's root canal, while Louie the swan falls ill, jeopardizing his release.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: It's a series of firsts when the Central Park Zoo welcomes its first-ever Atlantic puffin chick. A rhino called Penny undergoes a series of allergy tests, while an endangered species of gecko welcomes her first hatchling.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A trio of abandoned puma cubs arrives at the zoo, while the staff grows concerned that Ella, the oldest rhino, is not acting herself. Meanwhile, a Caribbean flamingo is born at the zoo after nearly two decades, and Otto the stallion makes his debut.

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: The Zoo says goodbye to beloved pandas Bai-Yun and Xiao Liwu as mother and cub prepare to return to China. Tembo the retired 'Hollywood' elephant tries traditional Chinese medicine for her arthritis. The Butterfly Jungle gets colored for the season.

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: After taking over the former red river hog habitat, a gazelle gives the team a big surprise. Staffers race to prepare a den when they suspect the amur leopard Satka is pregnant, and koalas are nursed back to health after being saved from the bushfires.

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego - California Tales
programme.desc: Hyena brothers Puru and Tuli prepare to share a habitat with the lions. Staff are ecstatic when zebra Bacari shows signs of being pregnant, and Mabel the pygmy hippo welcomes her first bundle of joy.

programme.title: Beast Buddies
programme.sub-title: Three Big Cats and a Grandma
programme.desc: A couple shares their home with over 80 slithery snakes, a Texas grandma spends quality time with a trio of big cats, and a cuddly cougar shares a studio apartment with his Russian roomies.

programme.title: Beast Buddies
programme.desc: A man spends his day devoted to a pack of wolves, another animal-lover is best friends with a gang of 20 bears, and a woman's favorite pastime is playing dress up with her pet gator.

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: After six years away, Mek the tiger returns to the Zoo. Two shy tree kangaroos, Spike and Polly, meet for the first time. And, with the Children's Zoo under construction, the keepers have to move over 100 animals, including a herd of reluctant goats.

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Rhino Kifaru is attempting to mate, despite his arthritic knees; tapir Jenny falls ill, and widowed porcupine Roxy meets a new mate.

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Rare okapi Stomp must woo female K'Tusha, there's a struggle to be pack leader among the African painted dogs, and Raja the Bornean river turtle meets two new prospective mates.

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Game wardens enforce the law across Texas. A hunting club has a trespassing issue. People are caught attempting to illegally cross the Rio Grande. An argument between neighbors is mediated. Fishermen receive citations on the Gulf of Mexico.

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Game wardens head to a home after getting a call about bucks fighting in Comal County. While patrolling the Brazos River, Kiel responds to a drowning in progress. A trespassing incident quickly turns into a drug case. Putnam hears shots fired nearby.

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: During the holiday weekend a jet skier is reported missing, while another is caught without a life vest. Warden Kiel witnesses a fist fight during the fireworks, and warden Cummings handles underage drinkers.

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Game Warden McGee rushes to a domestic altercation. Game Wardens Zuniga and Roel run into trespassers, while Provasnik inspects a potentially stolen jet ski. Game Wardens Richards and McGee team up on an investigation, and a baby squirrel is rescued.

programme.title: Louisiana Law
programme.desc: In Southern Louisiana, Lt. David Nunez and Sgt. Austin Arteaga investigate a group of bird hunters on opening day of Teal Season. Later, a repeated offender is busted for taking immature crabs and a late-night deer decoy leads to a hunter in handcuffs.

programme.title: Louisiana Law
programme.desc: As a storm rolls in over St. Tammany Parish, Cpl. Blaine Wagner and Cpl. Rick Clark assist in a search and rescue mission for a missing fisherman. Agents confront a repeat offender for harassing hunters and a felon is caught with an illegal firearm.

programme.title: Louisiana Law
programme.desc: In Ouachita Parish, a trespassing investigation leads to a dicey encounter and multiple seizures of deer. Agents confront a group of duck hunters who are spotted killing non-game birds, and health code violations are found during a routine oyster patrol.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Towne responds to a call about a hunter cornered by a pack of dogs. Officer Hannett tries to coax the truth from suspicious hunters. Lt. Boudreau leads a large night hunting operation that quickly takes an unexpected turn.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Crouse responds to a call about a nuisance raccoon, while Officer Towne searches for a deer attacked by coyotes. Officer Hannett monitors a suspicious fisherman and Officer St. Pierre responds to a call about an impaired driver.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Conservation Officers statewide join forces with volunteers and the National Guard to launch an intensive search for a missing hiker. In Littleton, Officer McKee gets news of a bear who has infiltrated a home in search of food.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Sgt. Pushee leads a multi-agency rescue mission to find a missing kayaker. A specialist is called in to locate a pesky bear roaming a residential area, and a boy is caught riding without a helmet and operating his ATV illegally.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer McDermott finds an abandoned truck, sparking a winding investigation. Officer Holmes and Sgt. Lucas rescue paddlers of a capsized canoe. Later, Holmes responds to a moose accident, while OFC. Frye consoles a bereft woman.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: At the annual ice fishing tournament in Washington, NH, numerous fishermen are cited for breaking the law. Meanwhile, Officer Canfield catches reckless snowmobilers riding without registrations then receives a call that has him rushing to the hospital.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: After an abandoned barrel is discovered, Officer Hannett works with local police to see if it's related to a 20-year-old cold case regarding a missing mother and daughter. Later, the popular GoNorth Snofest starts with a bang and ends in citations.

programme.title: North Woods Law: Protect and Preserve
programme.desc: In the dark of the night, Officers Hannet and Masucci rush to the aid of an injured hiker trapped on Mount Monadnock. Lt. Cheney and Officer Jones patrol the Hooksett Dam where river herring are spawning, and a bear causes chaos at Twin Mountain.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: A report of possible gunshots fired near a Police Chief's home has Officers on the hunt for answers, but what K9 Moxie discovers leads to a twist in the case. An ATV accident leaves a rider seriously injured, and a rabid raccoon puts lives in danger.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Bronson investigates a teen's social media post, boasting of illegally shooting a deer. Officer Canfield confronts a hunter over multiple violations. And, the dive team searches for a boat and its driver after a collision with another boat.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officers Arsenault confronts a hunter accused of hunting too close to a school and damaging property.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The ultimate portrait of our planet looks at the key factors that shape our natural history. In the Arctic spring, a mother polar bear and cubs have two weeks to cross the frozen sea. Time-lapse cameras capture the transformation created by floods.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mountain ranges reveals how animals rise to the challenge of mountain life. The snow leopard finds habitat in the largest glaciers of the world.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Follow the descent of rivers from their mountain sources to the sea. Witness unique and dramatic moments of animal behaviour, including a piranha frenzy and a showdown between otters and crocodiles.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Although often overlooked, caves are remarkable habitats with equally bizarre wildlife. This documentary provides a unique access to a hidden world of stalactites, stalagmites, snotites and troglodytes that brings a wealth of surprises.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Deserts cover one fifth of the planet and they are spreading every year. We think we are familiar with the Sahara and the Kalahari but what about the Gobi or the Atacama -so many deserts have hardly been explored.

programme.title: Meerkat Manor: Rise of the Dynasty

programme.title: Meerkat Manor: Rise of the Dynasty
programme.desc: There are unexpected outcomes for both families when an infestation at the nursery burrow forces the Whiskers to make a risky move with their youngest pups. Meanwhile heavily-pregnant Flint Lockwood leads Hakuna Matata in search of a new home.

programme.title: Meerkat Manor: Rise of the Dynasty
programme.desc: The good fortune of the Whiskers comes to a sudden end when history repeats itself with terrifying consequences for Swift. Meanwhile pregnant Flint leads Hakuna Matata home only to be confronted by local land-grabbers.

programme.title: Animal Babies
programme.desc: Young animals struggle to overcome challenges on the African savannah.

programme.title: Animal Babies
programme.desc: Many animals that live in water come on land to have their babies, and being born this way presents some major challenges for water babies to overcome.

programme.title: Animal Babies

programme.sub-title: The Best of Seven Worlds, One Planet

programme.title: Planet Earth: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: A journey from the intense heat of the tropics to the planet's frozen poles. Life has spread to almost every part of the ocean, but there are many different worlds within it, and each presents unique challenges.

programme.title: Planet Earth: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Visit the unknown to discover an unimaginable abundance of life in the pitch-black darkness of the seabed. Antarctica is the coldest, harshest and most remote continent on earth.

programme.title: Planet Earth: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: At the coast, two worlds collide. Coasts is the story of how our wildlife survives in this ever-changing world. It's a roller-coaster ride of heart-stopping action and epic drama, with characters from beautiful to bizarre.

programme.title: Planet Earth: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: In our green seas, competition is fierce. Sunlight powers vast kelp forests, mangroves, prairies of seagrass and blooms of algae. Here, animals must fight for space and food. In kelp forests, a common octopus must become the ultimate escape artist.

programme.title: Planet Earth: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Corals build themselves homes of limestone in the warm, clear, shallow seas of the tropics. Their reefs occupy less than one tenth of one per cent of the ocean floor, yet they are home to a quarter of all known marine species.

programme.title: Planet Earth: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: The big blue is the world's greatest wilderness. It is a marine desert far from shore and many kilometers deep with nothing to eat and nowhere to hide.

programme.title: Eden: Untamed Planet
